title: Amazon's "AI Ready" initiative offers free training and scholarships to promote AI education globally.
originSummary: Amazon has launched its "AI Ready" initiative to provide free AI skills training to 2 million people worldwide by 2025.

The initiative offers eight new and free AI and generative AI courses, a scholarship program for high school and university students, and a partnership with Code.org to educate students about generative AI.
A recent study conducted by AWS shows a high demand for AI talent and the potential for individuals with AI skills to earn up to 47% higher salaries.
The goal is to make AI education accessible to anyone interested in learning and harness the power of AI to solve complex problems.

title: Amazon's "AI Ready" Program Offers Free AI Classes in Talent Race
originSummary: Amazon is introducing "AI Ready," a program designed to train over two million individuals in artificial intelligence skills by 2025.
The goal of the initiative is to address the AI talent shortage and compete with companies such as Microsoft and Google.
This program aligns with the broader trend of companies investing in training workers in various AI-related fields.

title: Sam Altman Joins Microsoft to Lead New AI Project
originSummary: Sam Altman, former CEO of OpenAI, has joined Microsoft to lead a new AI project after leaving OpenAI.
Altman will head a new advanced AI research team at Microsoft, working alongside OpenAI co-founder Greg Brockman.
Despite Altman's departure, Microsoft remains committed to supporting OpenAI as a major financial backer. Emmett Shear, co-founder of Twitch, has been named as the new CEO of OpenAI.

title: Sam Altman's Ouster from OpenAI Leads to Microsoft Appointment
originSummary: Sam Altman, co-founder and former CEO of OpenAI, has joined Microsoft to lead their artificial intelligence research team.
Altman's departure from OpenAI was reportedly due to communication issues with the board.
OpenAI has appointed Mira Murati as interim CEO and Emmett Shear as its new interim CEO, following Altman's exit.

title: Sam Altman to Lead Microsoft's New Advanced AI Research Team
originSummary: Former OpenAI CEO Sam Altman will be joining Microsoft to head a new advanced AI research team, along with Greg Brockman, former OpenAI president and board chair.
Microsoft has invested a significant amount of money in OpenAI and has a strong technology partnership with the company.
Altman was removed from his position at OpenAI due to communication problems, and the company has since hired former Twitch CEO Emmett Shear as its new CEO.

title: 2 AI Stocks That Could Generate Massive Returns
originSummary: The Motley Fool is a financial services company that provides premium investing solutions, market analysis, and guidance.
They offer resources and advice on topics like investing basics, stock market information, retirement planning, money tips, credit cards, and insurance.
They highlight two AI stocks, Taiwan Semiconductor and UiPath, that they believe could generate substantial returns for investors.

title: Nvidia's AI strength fuels optimism amid China sales uncertainty
originSummary: Nvidia, the AI chip leader, is expected to announce positive revenue forecasts despite US restrictions on sales to China.
The Biden administration's ban on sales of Nvidia's high-end chips to China, which contributes over one-fifth of the company's revenue, has caused the company's stock to decline.
However, analysts believe that Nvidia may still be appealing to Chinese customers and that its revenue from China may become less important in the future.

title: Spotify enhances recommendations with Google's AI, expands into podcasts and audiobooks
originSummary: Spotify has partnered with Google Cloud to leverage large language models (LLMs) for improved podcast and audiobook recommendations.
The goal is to apply the success of Spotify's AI-powered music recommendation algorithms to non-music content.
LLMs will also be utilized to enhance user safety and detect potentially harmful content.
This collaboration aligns with Spotify's strategy to generate more revenue by expanding its offerings to include podcasts and audiobooks.

title: UN creates advisory body for global AI governance, Amazon tests humanoid robots, TikTok's new music-saving feature, Australia's container terminals recover from cyber attack, EU sets deadline for tech giants to protect children, Google's Jigsaw releases tool to detect terrorist content, and Atlas launches 3D generative AI platform.
originSummary: The UN is forming an advisory body to address AI governance challenges, which will consist of technology company executives, government officials, and AI academics.
Amazon is testing humanoid robots in its US warehouses to increase automation and free up human workers for other tasks.
TikTok now allows users to save songs from videos to their Spotify or Amazon Music accounts.
